thread.title: Ray Parlour insists current Arsenal squad can replicate 1998 title comeback by winning showdowns against rivals
thread.title_full: Ray Parlour insists current Arsenal squad can replicate 1998 title comeback by winning showdowns against rivals

author: John Cross
title: Ray Parlour insists current Arsenal squad can replicate 1998 title comeback by winning showdowns against rivals
text:
Sport Ray Parlour insists current Arsenal squad can replicate 1998 title comeback by winning showdowns against rivals Arsene Wenger's side won 13 out of 14 to overhaul Manchester United and Parlour believes the Gunners can repeat the trick if they win the matches against their title rivals Share Arsenal celebrate on Sunday - will they be lifting the title in May? (Photo: Reuters/Getty Images) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
There were two key moments in the 1997/98 season which took Arsenal from being also-rans in the title race to champions. 
Back on January 20, 1998, Arsenal were fifth in the Premier League and 11 points behind leaders Manchester United. 
But the Gunners had a crucial players’ meeting after they lost 3-1 at home to Blackburn in December when the old guard told French midfielders Patrick Vieira and Emmanuel Petit to start protecting their back four. 
That signalled a transformation in their performances under Arsene Wenger in his first full season in charge at Arsenal. 
But Arsenal’s remarkable winning run really kicked in at the end of January, winning 13 out of 14 which eventually saw them pip United. Ian Wright kisses his captain Tony Adams (Photo: Getty) Adams with boss Arsene Wenger (Photo: Getty) Ray Parlour and Marc Overmars (Photo: Reuters) 
And the second key moment was Arsenal’s win at Manchester United on March 14, 1998 because it saw off a direct rival and gave Wenger’s players a huge psychological boost and sense of belief. 
Ex-Arsenal midfielder Ray Parlour said: “I think that was probably Marc Overmars’ best game for the club. It was definitely his most important goal. 
“A lot of teams have bad patches. We used to have a bad patch in November. Even in the 98 season we had a bad patch. It always seemed to be November, no idea why. But you can still come back from it. Marc Overmars scores for Arsenal against Manchester United (Photo: Getty) Arsenal beat United at Old Trafford to go on to win the title (Photo: Getty) 
“Arsenal are eight points behind Chelsea now, but Chelsea have got Liverpool coming up, they’ve got Arsenal coming up, they win those two games or get good results in those two games then it’s all over. 
“But if Arsenal can win their big games then that’s when you claw back the points in the title race. 
“It will basically come down to those games when the teams at the top play each other because they are the big games that generally decide the title race.”
